question: Identify the tense in the sentence: 'By next year, she will have completed her project.'
Which sentence is in the past perfect tense?
options: She had written a letter before he arrived.
She writes a letter every day.
answer: She had written a letter before he arrived.

question: Which form of the verb should be used in the blank? 'She ______ (complete) her assignment before the teacher arrived.'
Choose the correct sentence with the right tense usage.
Which of the following sentences is in the future continuous tense?
options: I will complete my work by evening.
I will be completing my work by evening.
I completed my work in the evening.
I complete my work in the evening.
answer: I will be completing my work by evening.

question: What is the base form of the verb in the sentence: 'She had gone to the market'?
Identify the correct verb form: 'By the time you reach there, the meeting ______ (start) already.'
Which sentence correctly follows the sequence of tenses?
options: He said that he will come tomorrow.
He said that he comes tomorrow.
He said that he would come tomorrow.
He said that he came tomorrow.
answer: He said that he would come tomorrow.

question: What is the tense of the sentence: 'She has been reading for two hours'?
Which sentence is in the passive voice?
options: The project was completed by her.
answer: The project was completed by her.

question: Which of the following sentences is in the correct past perfect tense?
options: When I reached the station, the train left.
When I reached the station, the train had left.
When I reach the station, the train had left.
When I reached the station, the train has left.
answer: When I reached the station, the train had left.

question: Fill in the blank with the correct verb: 'Neither of the students ______ (be) present today.'
Which of the following sentences is in the present perfect tense?
Identify the verb in the sentence: 'The teacher is explaining the topic clearly.'
What type of verb is 'has been' in the sentence: 'She has been working hard'?
Which sentence is grammatically correct?
options: She do not know the answer.
She does not know the answer.
answer: She does not know the answer.

question: Choose the correct tense: 'They ______ (play) football when it started raining.'
Choose the correct sentence:
options: He has been finished his homework.
He had been finished his homework.
He is been finished his homework.

question: Which sentence uses the correct verb form?
options: If he was here, he would help.
If he were here, he would help.
If he is here, he would help.
If he has been here, he would help.
answer: If he were here, he would help.

question: What is the correct form of the verb? 'She ______ (visit) her grandmother every weekend.'
Identify the incorrect sentence:
options: I am go to the market.
I am going to the market.
answer: I am go to the market.

question: Which sentence correctly follows the past perfect rule?
options: After he arrived, we had dinner.
After he had arrived, we had dinner.
After he arrived, we have dinner.
After he arrived, we were having dinner.
answer: After he had arrived, we had dinner.

question: Which sentence correctly uses the past perfect continuous tense?
options: I was waiting for two hours before she arrived.
I had been waiting for two hours before she arrived.
I had waited for two hours before she arrived.
I have been waiting for two hours before she arrived.
answer: I had been waiting for two hours before she arrived.

question: Which sentence correctly follows the sequence of tenses?
options: She said she will complete the work by evening.
She said she would complete the work by evening.
She says she would complete the work by evening.
She said she completes the work by evening.
answer: She said she would complete the work by evening.

question: Fill in the blank with the correct verb form: 'I wish I ______ (be) a little taller.'
Which of the following sentences is in the future perfect continuous tense?
options: He will have been studying for five hours by then.
He will be studying for five hours by then.
He will study for five hours by then.
He will have studied for five hours by then.
answer: He will have been studying for five hours by then.

question: Identify the error in the sentence: 'He didn’t knew the answer to the question.'
Choose the correct indirect speech for: He said, 'I am busy now.'
options: He said that he is busy now.
He said that he was busy then.
He said that he was busy now.
He said he is being busy.
answer: He said that he was busy then.

question: Identify the correct indirect speech: She said, 'I will call you tomorrow.'
options: She said that she would call me tomorrow.
She said that she will call me the next day.
She said that she would call me the next day.
She said that she called me tomorrow.
answer: She said that she would call me the next day.

question: Convert into direct speech: He said that he had finished his homework.
options: He said, 'I have finished my homework.'
He said, 'I had finished my homework.'
He said, 'I was finishing my homework.'
answer: He said, 'I had finished my homework.'

question: Choose the correct indirect speech: The teacher said, 'Honesty is the best policy.'
options: The teacher said that honesty was the best policy.
The teacher said that honesty is the best policy.
The teacher told that honesty is the best policy.
The teacher says that honesty was the best policy.
answer: The teacher said that honesty is the best policy.

question: Which of the following changes correctly in indirect speech: She said, 'Do you like coffee?'
options: She said if I liked coffee.
She asked if I like coffee.
She asked if I liked coffee.
She said that I liked coffee.
answer: She asked if I liked coffee.

question: Which of the following sentences correctly changes into indirect speech: He said, 'May you succeed in life!'
options: He wished me that I may succeed in life.
He wished that I might succeed in life.
He told that I would succeed in life.
He wished I should succeed in life.
answer: He wished that I might succeed in life.

question: Choose the correct sentence: 'He told me that he ______ there before.'
Convert into indirect speech: The teacher said, 'Keep quiet.'
options: The teacher ordered to keep quiet.
The teacher ordered them to keep quiet.
The teacher said them to keep quiet.
The teacher told them to keep quiet.
answer: The teacher ordered them to keep quiet.

question: Choose the correct determiner: 'I have ______ idea how to solve this problem.'
Choose the correct determiner: 'She doesn’t have ______ money left in her account.'
Fill in the blank with the correct determiner: '______ students in the class passed the exam with flying colors.'
Choose the correct determiner: 'There are only ______ apples left in the basket.'
Which sentence correctly uses a determiner?
options: She has much books to read.
She has a few books to read.
She has little books to read.
She has a little books to read.
answer: She has a few books to read.

question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
Choose the correct sentence: 'He has ______ knowledge about the subject.'
Choose the correct determiner: 'I met ______ European tourist yesterday.'
Which of the following sentences is correct?
options: I need an information about the project.
I need a few information about the project.
I need some information about the project.
I need a information about the project.
answer: I need some information about the project.

question: Choose the correct sentence: 'Can you lend me ______ rupees?'
Choose the correct determiner: 'There is ______ water in the bottle.'
Choose the correct determiner: '______ book on the table is mine.'
Which of the following correctly changes into indirect speech: She said, 'Do not touch the wire!'
options: She said me not to touch the wire.
She told me not to touch the wire.
She asked me not to touch the wire.
She said me that not to touch the wire.
answer: She told me not to touch the wire.

question: Choose the correct sentence: 'He said, ‘How are you?’ in indirect speech is:
options: He asked me that how I was.
He asked me how I was.
He asked me that how was I.
He asked me how was I.
answer: He asked me how I was.

question: Choose the correct determiner: 'I have invited ______ of my close friends to the party.'
Choose the correct sentence: 'I met ______ old friend of mine yesterday.'
Which sentence correctly uses a modal verb?
options: He can to swim very well.
He may to swim very well.
He must to swim very well.

question: Which modal verb is used to express **necessity**?
Choose the correct sentence using a modal verb:
options: You must to finish your homework.

question: Which of the following sentences expresses **possibility**?
options: He can be at home now.
He must be at home now.
He may be at home now.
He will be at home now.
answer: He may be at home now.

question: Which modal verb expresses **ability**?
Choose the most appropriate modal verb: 'You ______ apologize for your mistake.'
Which sentence correctly expresses **permission**?
options: You ought to take my pen.

question: Which modal verb is used to express **strong certainty**?
Choose the correct sentence using a modal verb:
options: He might studies in the library.
He might study in the library.
He might to study in the library.
He might studied in the library.
answer: He might study in the library.

question: Which of the following expresses **a polite request**?
options: Can you lend me your book?
You must lend me your book.
You will lend me your book.
You have to lend me your book.
answer: Can you lend me your book?

question: Choose the correct sentence: 'He ______ be the best player on the team, but he still needs practice.'
Which modal verb is used to **give advice**?
Which sentence expresses **prohibition**?
options: You may not enter the room.
answer: You may not enter the room.

question: Which modal verb is used to express **lack of necessity**?
Choose the correct sentence: 'I ______ go to the doctor. I'm feeling fine now.'
Choose the correct modal verb: 'If you practice daily, you ______ become a great musician.'
Choose the correct sentence: 'You ______ take an umbrella. It looks like it might rain.'
Choose the correct modal verb: 'If I were you, I ______ apologize to her immediately.'
Which modal verb expresses a **formal obligation**?
Choose the correct sentence: 'He ______ have left already, but I am not sure.'
Which sentence has correct subject-verb agreement?
options: The boy play in the park.
The boy plays in the park.
The boy playing in the park.
The boy have played in the park.
answer: The boy plays in the park.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'Each of the students _____ a book.'
Identify the correct sentence:
options: The list of items are on the table.
The list of items is on the table.
The list of items were on the table.
The list of items have been on the table.
answer: The list of items is on the table.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'Neither of the players _____ ready for the match.'
Which sentence has correct subject-verb agreement?
options: My friends and I enjoys playing football.
My friends and I enjoy playing football.
My friends and I enjoying playing football.
My friends and I has enjoy playing football.
answer: My friends and I enjoy playing football.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'One of my brothers _____ an engineer.'
Which sentence follows subject-verb agreement rules?
options: The book and the pen is on the table.
The book and the pen are on the table.
The book and the pen was on the table.
The book and the pen has been on the table.
answer: The book and the pen are on the table.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'Neither the teacher nor the students _____ present today.'
Choose the correct sentence:
options: A number of students is absent today.
A number of students are absent today.
A number of students was absent today.
A number of students has been absent today.
answer: A number of students are absent today.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'The committee _____ divided in their opinion.'
Identify the correct sentence:
options: Ten kilometers is a long distance.
Ten kilometers are a long distance.
Ten kilometers have a long distance.
Ten kilometers were a long distance.
answer: Ten kilometers is a long distance.

question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: The news have been very interesting.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'Everybody _____ to the meeting on time.'
Choose the correct sentence:
options: The teacher, along with the students, are going on a trip.
The teacher, along with the students, is going on a trip.
The teacher, along with the students, have going on a trip.
The teacher, along with the students, were going on a trip.
answer: The teacher, along with the students, is going on a trip.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'Either the manager or the employees _____ responsible for this error.'
Choose the correct sentence:
options: Twenty rupees is not enough to buy this book.
Twenty rupees are not enough to buy this book.
Twenty rupees were not enough to buy this book.
Twenty rupees have been not enough to buy this book.
answer: Twenty rupees is not enough to buy this book.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'Each of the boys _____ a prize.'
Choose the correct sentence:
options: The quality of the apples is good.
The quality of the apples are good.
The quality of the apples were good.
The quality of the apples have been good.
answer: The quality of the apples is good.

question: Which sentence has correct subject-verb agreement?
options: There is many problems in this project.
There are many problems in this project.
There was many problems in this project.
There has many problems in this project.
answer: There are many problems in this project.

question: Which verb correctly completes the sentence? 'The majority of the audience _____ happy with the performance.'
